messages: A big house has 13 doors but only 12 can be closed. Which door remains open?
A big pepper came from a small pepper, that's how it grows. What am I?
A bird doesn't fly, a fish doesn't swim, and I don't breathe. Yet I have wings and I'm also made of five letters. What am I?
A bird that lays blue eggs, but isn't a bird. What am I?
A bird with a broken wing, Can't fly, but it's still king. Where might I be?
A book that is read but still heavy.
A book that you read but is empty, what am I?
A box I am, with treasures untold, open me and wealth you behold. But add one gold piece, my value will unfold.
A box I may seem, but I'm not a container, I hold the impossible, the intangible, within my bounds, I'm the infinite.
A box of matches, a fire, a pile of ashes – what am I, at every stage?
A box of matches, a fire, and I am something in between. I'm often used to keep you warm, and sometimes to make a meal.
A box with holes, yet it holds water tight, what is it?
A box with no hinges, no key, no lid. Inside are gold coins, but I'm not a bank.
A box with no hinges, no lid, no locks or key, still it can keep things inside, tell me, what am I?
A box with no hinges, no lid, no top or bottom, only sides. How can it be closed?
A box with three sides, yet has a lid, what am I?
A box without a hinge, a key without a lock, take me out and I will bind, take me in and I will loosen, I am never still I'm always on the move. What am I?
A box without hinges, key or lid, yet golden treasures fill it inside.
A box without hinges, key, or lid, yet gold within it is hid. What am I?
A bubble in the air, a tear in your fear.
A child is born but does not cry or breathe. How can this be?
A city I build, with towers reaching for the sky, I make the wealthy rich and the poor stay poor, I see all and none see me. What am I?
A color I wear, in morning I'm blue, midday I'm new, but in the evening all hue.
A color less than white, but not quite black, in the dark it's found, with a peculiar snack.
A color that is not on the rainbow. What is it?
A color that's not really a color, but without it, no picture is clear. I'm found in the rainbow, but not on a palette.
A colorless rainbow, found in a room, Where the cold winds blow, it sometimes looms.
A colorless substance, yet I can make things bright, I'm found in the air and in the light, I am life's essence, day and night.
A constant companion, always at my side, I've never been without you, yet I can't lose you if I tried. What am I?
A container full, yet never holds; full when it's not, and empty when it's full. What am I?

A container holding a certain liquid is filled up one-third from the top. The level of the liquid falls 1/10th of its height when a marble the size of a marble is added. What is the container made of?
A continuous long line. No first. No last. Cut it anywhere and two ends are there. What am I?
A creature I'm telling you of, which has one foot in front, and another in its mother's home. It spends the morning in a pond, and the evening on a tree. What creature am I talking about?
A creature I'm, of liquid form, with colors ever bright And in my depths, where darkness reigns, jewels I hide, both big and small, in countless pains.
A creature born within a house, never goes outside, fed on scraps and leftovers, it eventually becomes large and strong.
A creature has 14 heads, 14 eyes, and 14 legs. How long is its tail?
A creature has a throne but no legs, A river runs near it but it doesn't drink, What is it?
A creature has two arms but cannot clap; it has a bed but it cannot sleep. What is it?

A creature is found in wood, for wood it is sometimes made. A creature is found in water, for water it is sometimes made. A creature is found in a barn, and for grain it is frequently laid. What creature is that?
A creature living under water, with no legs, no mouth, and no arms. It can carry gold on its back. What is it?
A creature of habit, I visit each day, at the same hour, without delay. I creep through your home, leaving a trail of crumbs, in search of a tasty snack that is surely doomed.
A creature of shadow and stealth, tails often long and curled. In the night, we dance and feast on the world.
A creature that crawls on land and flies in the air, with wings on its back and no fear. I'll take you to your destination but only if you dare. What am I?
A creature that does not bark, doesn't roar, doesn't meow, but goes "hmmm." What am I?
A creature that does not breathe or eat, that does not rest or sleep, that has no feeling, but is the beginning of all life. What am I?
A creature that does not exist at birth, nor has a death. What am I?
A creature that doesn't run but gets away. With a crack in the night that's loud and bright, it's vanished from sight.
A creature that doesn't run, but can outpace the wind. Has a heart that does not pump, and yet it will grind.
A creature that dwells beneath the seas, with a thousand arms and eight long fins. It's larger than a whale, and none have seen its head. What am I?
A creature that goes on four legs in the morning, on two legs at noon, and on three legs in the evening.
A creature that grows in the dark, has no legs, no arms, no eyes, nor feels, and yet it is born in the light. What is it?
A creature that grows smaller as it goes. Hoped to be found at the end of the roads, but is never there when seeking to knows.
A creature that has a head, a heart, but no body, speaks without opening its mouth and is carried on the wind.
A creature that has four legs in the morning, two legs at noon, and three legs in the evening. What am I?
A creature that has keys in its head, gold in its mouth, and silver in its claws. It is never bought or sold, but it can be borrowed and hired. What is it?
A creature that hisses in the night, brings terror with its sight, in water it struggles to survive, its body made of many intertwined.
A creature that is always growing, the bigger it gets, the harder it is to see. What is it?
A creature that is carried on water, yet is not a boat.
A creature that is not alive but can grow; if you put it in the earth, it can reach a room; if you split it, it can only be mended by time.

A creature that is not alive, but grows and develops gradually. It has a mouth that does not eat, eyes that do not see, arms that do not bend, and legs that do not walk. Yet it is used by almost everyone. What am I?
A creature that is not alive, but grows; Has hands but cannot grasp, and eyes but cannot see.
A creature that is not alive, but is anechoic – this means it absorbs sound instead of reflecting it. It is found in vast quantities in a desert in New Mexico, USA. What am I?
A creature that never grows old, Its eggs are not round, covered in silver and gold.
A creature that roams at night, in silence and in might. In gardens, it lurks, in shadows it hides. What is it?
A creature that roams at night, turning white as the day takes light, It weaves a silken thread, leaving trails on your bed.
A creature that roams the forest night, has a heart that beats bright. By day, it hides in a burrow, revealed only by its shimmering glow.
A creature that sleeps in the desert, yet never drinks water.
A creature that speaks with its tongue out, and listens with its ear on the ground. It brings food to the table, yet never eats a sound.
A creature that walks in the night, With a frightful cry, And a bark that's full of might. What am I?
A creature that walks on four legs in the morning, two legs at noon, and three legs in the evening.
A creature that wanders by night, With a bark that's loud and fright, Loses its head in the morning light, What am I?
A creature that wanders by night, with a rhyme in its bite. In a mask of red, without a single light. A silent hunter, in myth and in lore.
A creature that's always hungry, a fire it is not. It eats gold and diamonds, nothing less will do. What am I?
A creature that's born on Monday, and lives for seven days, what should I feed it on Tuesday?
A creature that's invisible when it's raining but becomes visible when the sun is shining. I can be found in a field, often causing mischief. What am I?
A creature that's light as a feather, yet the strongest man cannot hold it for much longer than a minute. What am I?
A creature that's light yet heavy in weight. In air it can't keep its feet, but on land it can't escape. What am I?
A creature that's long and thin, it's used to measure, but it's not a pen.
A creature with a head, two arms and no legs, tells us when it's time to rest.
A creature with a heart of stone, dwells in a castle all alone, what am I?
A creature with a heart that doesn't beat, it can live in the dust or on the street. It can travel all alone, without a wheel, What am I?
A creature with a hundred eyes, it weaves the fabric of our skies.
A creature with countless eyes and limbs, its actions predict, its presence chills. In the depths of night, it seeks its prey, and in the day, it hides and sleeps.
A creature with eyes, but cannot see. Mouth, but cannot speak. Nose, but cannot smell. What is it?
A creature with four faces, always smiling, yet it never frowns.
A creature with four legs in the morning, two at noon, and three in the evening. What is it?
A creature with many feet, It changes direction, never beats, In a race against time, it seldom meets.
A creature with no neck, has a ringed tail, loses its head, yet it's not frail.
A creature with the voice of a thousand bees, carries the weight of the world up high upon its knees. When it sings, the wind whispers secrets through the trees.
A creature with thirteen tails and cannot be tamed, once caught, it cannot remain. What am I?
A creature with wings, not meant for flight. Its voice is loud, with piercing sight. In ancient tales of valor, it strikes fear in the night.
A crystal clear pane that can be shattered by a tiny stone.
A day long, a lifetime short.
A five-letter word becomes shorter when you take away two letters. What is it?
A four-letter word, take the first letter and add two more, it becomes a word for a cup, what's it spelled in flowers?
A friend of winter, a foe of summer, What am I?
A friend to all, and a companion to the end, when I am near I mend the heart, no need for pretend.
A friend to some, a foe to others, I speak in tongues that humans often stutter, I am the wind that carries songs.
A frozen lake has the same amount of it as a cup full, what is it?
A frozen lake, a broken seal, a sudden squeal, a frightened deal. What am I?
A frozen treasure, hidden deep in the ground. I am a thief, and I am a king.
A gentle, soaring creature with wings spanned wide, I glide above the world, in a skybound tide. With a graceful beat, and a gentle song, I make the winds my plaything, and journey onto the dawn.
A giant's cup, so large and round, holds a single drop, no sound.
A giant's plaything, I'm tossed in the air, high above the ground, with a mighty flare. When I reach the peak, I pause for a breath, before crashing back down in a burst of death.
A golden question, answer I seek, shines bright in the night, yet daylight it speaks.
A heavy thing that makes a loud noise when thrown. What am I?
A heavy weight that rises when lit. It shines bright but melts away in the rain.
A hidden treasure that's sought and found By some, but never by the proud. What's not at the end of the rainbow?
A hidden world waiting to be explored, but never swirls?
A hole in a wall, a seat, and a back. I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. What am I?
A hollow, empty man, with wanderlust in his core, He craves the road, but cannot explore. Who is this roaming man?
A house with no doors or windows, where do the ghosts reside?
A large body of water that you can't step in, it's surrounded by land on all sides, if you're lost at its edge, you may eventually find your way.
A large container swings back and forth with a load, yet nothing is ever added or removed. What is it?
A large house is filled with them, but only a few are alive. What are they?
A living thing, yet no heart beats. A master of illusion, creator of deceits. In every corner, behind every seat. Be gone with a whisper, or a sneak.
A living, breathing puzzle, a paradox in time, an enigma, wrapped in rhyme. An answer, seeking the seeker, on life's endless, winding chime.
A long sleep that you go to every night when the day is spent. What am I?
A long time I slept and I dreamed I was a pine tree, I awoke and found I was a man. What was I?
A long time ago in a faraway land there was a fear that would kill every man. What was it?
A long time ago, I dropped from a tree. From my skin, comes a drink, refreshing and sweet. What am I?
A long time ago, I was a man. I caught many fish. Now, I hold them for the man who catches me. What am I?

A long time ago, a man found a magic potion that granted immortality. He decided to hide it from the world because he knew it would be misused. He wrote down the instructions for finding it and handed it to a trusted friend. The friend passed it to another, and so on, down the generations. Today, this manuscript is still in existence. What is it?
A long word that spelled backwards is still the same word. What is it?
A long-haired woman, a naked man, a six-legged animal, and a bird with a broken wing. What are they in the order that they appear as the letters in this word are read?
A long-legged creature, swift as it can be, it jumps without touching the ground, it's known to you and me.
A long-lived friend, a faithful companion, the day would be dull without – what am I?
A man goes to bed every night, but never gets tired. Why?
A man is found hanging in a forest with a rope around his neck. Yet, there's no evidence of a tree nearby. How did he commit suicide?

A man walks into a room. He is holding a gun in his left hand. In the room, there is a table with three switches. When he flips the first switch, his wife dies. When he flips the second switch, his brother dies. He doesn't flip the third switch, and then leaves the room. Who was the man?
A man was found dead in the road, with no wounds upon him. Yet it wasn't an accident; it was no natural cause. What could have killed him?
A master of disguise, I hide in plain sight, taking many forms, day and night. From a simple stone, to a bird in flight, I'm the endless, beautiful, and often elusive, chameleon of life.
A maze that twists, entwines and confuses, I'm found in the heart of a puzzle, I make the brain throb and rejoice.
A mirror reflects what is not. I speak words that are never spoken. What am I?
A mirror that reflects all but itself, a puzzle wrapped in a riddle, shrouded in mystery deep.
A mirror's friend, I lie in wait, reflecting your features with unmatched weight. Smooth and shiny, I reveal your innermost self, but only when you're not yourself.
A mirror's reflection, a shadow's form, an echoes call in life's great song. What am I?
A monster has a face, a neck, two arms, but no body. What is it?
A mother watches me become, My roots reach deep, my branches spread wide, I grow stronger every year, What am I?
A mother, a bottle, and a nun. What do they have in common?
A mountain of treasure, a treasure of silver and gold, I'm often stolen, but never grows old. What am I?
A mute man's sister held me tight in her hand, I came from a stone, yet I'm hard to understand.
A never-ending source of light, Seen just briefly in the darkest night.
A never-ending thing that's always new, filled with blue and brightly viewed. Seen from above, it's calm and still, but from below, a raging rush with a deadly chill.
A palindrome that is common: read it the same way from left to right and from right to left.
A palm full of ice can hold it, a bucket of it can drown it, but it can never be sold in the supermarket. What is it?
A penny, the answer to the riddle is a penny.
A person with noarms or legs, living inside your home. What am I?
A person's heart beats hundreds daily, What am I?
A person's name from a far-off land, What you call me is what I am at hand.
A puzzle in the shape of a question, I am. I'm born from an egg, but not an animal. I'm taken from a mine, but not a gem. What am I?
A puzzle in three parts, hidden in plain sight, Unraveling it brings joy and delight. What's seen by many but understood by few?
A question I ask of all, but none can answer me: what am I?
A riddle that speaks in rhymes, I am a container, holding wine. When poured out, I'm empty, but when full, I'm divine.
A river's constant companion, never touches its bed.
A sanctuary for the most sincere.
A seed I am, which in the heart I hide. In its own good time, I come to life, then spread my wings and take the sky.
A seed in a hand, becomes a tree in the land. But first, it must face the frost and the scorching sun.
A seven-letter word, take away its middle letter, leaving one vowel behind, what remains?
A simple question is asked, three letters are spoken aloud, yet the answer lies hidden within this riddle, shrouded and unbound. What is it?
A simple rhyme with nine, I'm often played at weddings fine. My letters change, creating a new name, can you solve this riddle, it's quite the same?
A sleuth in the shadows, a seeker of secrets, I unravel mysteries, no case too complex. I'm swift and silent, unseen and unheard, a master of disguises, a seeker of the concealed.
A small creature that stays in a box, when taken out, it's a treat for many, but beware, it might outfox.
A small insect that can travel over a great distance without moving, how?
A sound you cannot smell, color you cannot see, what begins and ends but never is.
A stone I am, not hard nor round. I can be seen standing on the highest ground. What am I?
A symbol of love, a pledge of loyalty, I'm given in a vow, I'm worth more than gold.
A tall man shaves every day, yet keeps his beard. How?
A thief took my heart, my mind is all that I kept. What was it that I lost, dear friend?
A thing comes from nothing, it's bought and sold, tasted but never eated, touched but never felt. What is it?
A thing comes in pieces of 7, without which we can't live a week. What am I talking about?
A thing made of water, yet it’s not wet, you can see it through and through, without it, life’s regret. What is it?
A thing made of wood and some strings, it sings both sad and merry things. What is it?
A thing meets its end but never begins. What am I?
A thing of beauty, broken, lying in the corner, neglected, waiting for a master's gentle touch.
A thing of beauty, broken, saved in a jar. What am I?
A thing of beauty, thrown in the sea, becomes a beast, a fearsome entity.
A thing of beauty, yet a cause of dismay, it fills up rooms, but tries to slip away.
A thing of beauty, yet not alive, can shatter and leave us alive. In cold weather, it's a pain, yet in warm, a sweet refrain.
A thing of ore that's never weary, melting with the touch, and hard as ice while it's hot: What is it?
A thing so light it takes the wind to tell it to move, yet it will not move. What is it?
A thing that fills up a room and may be taken through a keyhole. What is it?
A thing that is always hungry, but never eats. It has feet but cannot walk. What is it?
A thing that is always in front of me; I can see it, touch it and even take it in my hands, but if I drop it I have to buy a new one every day; what is it?
A thing that is always in front of you but can't be seen, can you tell me what it is?
A thing that is always in front of you, but can't be seen, can't be touched, yet taken away from you.
A thing that is always in front, It can't be seen or touched. Inventors seem to have a knack for it.
A thing that is always in front, yet can't be seen or touched or felt or weighed, What am I?
A thing that is always in the way, I'll lend it to you, but I'll never get it back. What is it?
A thing that is borrowed for use, returned with a little abuse. When old it's discarded, a bitter truth to choose.
A thing that is broken if it is crossed, yet whole if it's dotted so.
A thing that is light as a feather, but even the strongest man cannot hold it for much more than a minute. What is it?
A thing that is light as a feather, yet the strongest man cannot hold it for much longer than a minute. What is it?
A thing that is light, and is made to be thrown. It glows when it's wet and is silent when it's broken.
A thing that is lighted at night but not at noon. I am also lit at noon, but not at night. What am I?
A thing that is lighted but not Set alight, to give light through smoky flame. What am I?
A thing that is not alive, but still grows; it doesn't have lungs, but it needs air; it doesn't have a mouth, but water kills it. What is it?
A thing that is often broken, never mended, is brought out on a cloudy day. What is it?
A thing that is often small, begins with T, ends with T, and if you add water to it, it gets bigger. What is it?
A thing that's always on fire, but never gets burnt, what is it?
A thing that's light, it is tossed in the air, when it comes down, your troubles will share.
A thing with a thousand faces, unknown, yet felt by all. It brings joy, it brings woe, in its mirror we see our own soul.
A thing without weight or force, yet strong enough to hold the stars in course. It's present at every beginning, and every ending.
A thing without weight, I fill your home, if taken away, you'd feel its absence, alone.
A thing without weight, yet the strongest where it is, what is it?
A thing you throw away, but which you use most. What thing is that?
A thing you use for writing, but it's not a pen, A tool you use for drawing, but it's not a pencil. What am I?
A thing, that's light as a feather, yet the strongest man cannot held for much longer than an hour.
A thought that's thought, but never blurred.
A three-letter word becomes longer when you add two letters to it. What is it?
A three-letter word begins and ends with an E, but only contains one letter. What is it?
A three-letter word that becomes longer when you add two letters to it. What is it?
A three-letter word, if you add two letters, it becomes five letters longer. What is it?
A three-letter word, often found at the heart of a word, removing it changes the meaning, what is it?
A tiny creature living in a tree, Sings a merry tune, as happy as can be. With a voice so sweet, and skin so thin, Climbs higher up, as day turns to din.
A tiny creature that lives in the wind, Can pass through screens, yet not through a thin, Could be carried by the tiniest of man, What am I?
A tiny creature, often unseen, dwells in the heart of a pine, making resin flow. What am I?
A tiny seed, in the ground it lies, it needs sun, water, growth, and time, when blooming, what am I?
A treasure hunter's quest, a pirate's hidden stash, the answer to this riddle, is found at the end of a map's lastash. What am I?
A trickster, friend, and foe in routine.
A vegetable that is often used in stuffing and can be found buried in the ground. What am I?
A vital part of our daily lore.
A wanderer in the night, Shines bright, yet stays hidden, Its light is a beacon, A sight forbidden.
A woman holds me in her hand, but she'll never own me. What am I?
A woman shot her husband, then held him in her arms. She called out for help as she cradled his head. Why did she call out for help?
A woman shot her husband, then she called the doctor. He came and he couldn't do a thing, for the bullet was still in him. Who was the woman's husband?
A woman's most precious possession, she never uses, but can't live without it.
A word of five letters, speak it right, In winter's chill, brings sunlight.
A word of five letters, spoken when you don't know what to say.
A word of five letters. Take away the first letter and it becomes silent. Take away the last letter and it becomes hollow. What word is it?
A word of four letters that becomes shorter when you add two letters to it. What word is it?
A word of four letters, spoken after a letter, makes the letter itself double. What are these?
A word of four letters, spoken in a house is fine. Spoken outside, it's a crime. What word is it?
A word of four letters, three letters take it away, two letters remain, one vowel among them. Speak it out loud, What do you say?
A word of four letters, which, when spoken three times in a row, will have you up and about. What is it?
A word of six letters, five letters take it away, three letters add 21 to its weight. What is it?
A word of six letters, takes away a breath, can scarcely be heard, and brings ruin to death.
A word of six letters, the last three being water. The first three being air. What is it?
A word of three letters formed in the ice, what am I?
A word of three letters long, can hold the longest tales, tell me what it is that I name.
A word of three letters long, often mispronounced but always means good, what is it?
A word of three letters long, the shortest word in English that contains all five vowels.
A word of three letters long, which changes meaning depending on where it falls as part of a larger word. What is it?
A word of three letters that means 'to go' when added to another word of two letters for 'go' gives three letters for 'come.' What are the words?
A word of three letters, spoken after a cough, followed by a hack, a sneeze, or a hawk. What is it?
A word of three letters, spoken after rain, is a description of rain's behavior. What is it?
A word of three letters, spoken aloud has meaning but when written down it has none. What word is it?
A word of three letters, spoken in anger, may never be unsaid. What is it?
A word of three letters, spoken soft and low, adds warmth to every room, makes cold hearts glow.
A word of three letters, spoken when a child is hurt. If you save but one, it would be worth its weight in fruit. What is it?
A word of three letters, spoken, gives a cough.
A word of two syllables, if spelled backwards remains the same; what word is that?
A word spoken in a whisper, a thought seldom shared. In silence, it grows, in the darkness, it dares. What is it?
A word that becomes shorter when you add two letters to it. What is it?
A word that begins and ends with an 'e', but only contains one letter. What is it?
A word that gives a great feeling Of fear and of triumph, When we hear it, it comes with a peal, We hear it in battle, we hear it in a duel.
A word that gives a smile is seldom heard. What word is it?
A word that has two meanings, light as a feather, stable as a tree, I'm the answer to a question, I'm the opposite of you and me.
A word that is a rhyme for orange, purple, and a prune, what am I?
A word that is pronounced R-O-T-T-E-N, reveals the secret I've got. It begins as a fruit, then transforms anew, when tossed on the ground, what am I?
A word that is pronounced the same when spoken in the present, past, and future tenses. What is it?
A word that is silent when spoken, a lie that is believed, a deceit that is practiced. What is it?
A word that is silent when you speak it, yet it can be deafening in its absence.
A word that is spoken when things have reached their end.
A word that is sung, and a place where it's found. It makes the heart dance, and puts a smile on the round. What is it?
A word that is the same forwards and backwards. What word is that?
A word that looks like cake but if you pronounce incorrectly, you can be in trouble. What is it?
A word that means all things, often mumbled at the start, is lost at the end, and can be found in the middle of a park.
A word that means the opposite of itself, it makes a paradox true. What is it?
A word that means to make clear and free from mistakes, but also means to rob a bank. What is it?
A word that means to put on a play, but can also mean to deceive. What is it?
A word that means to run, but when you add two letters it flies.
A word that starts with an 'E', ends with an 'E', but only contains one letter. What is it?
A word that starts with an E, ends with an E, but only contains one letter. What is it?
A word that used to be five letters long, now has eight. What is it?
A word that's spoken three times, becomes a lie. A truth told once, remains the truth, for the echoes in the soul, it births a new truth.
A word that's sweet, but not something to eat, It's spoken when you're sad, sometimes it makes you complete.
A word that’s spoken five times, keeps a secret from five.
A word which is spelled the same backwards as forwards.
A word, if you take away one letter, it becomes a word that means sad. What is that word?
Able to travel far, yet never leaves its home, holds water without a container, always hungry, but can never be satisfied.
An English monarch's head is on a Dutch girl's shoulders. I have hands but can't clap, and I have a tongue but can't rap. What am I?
An empty bottle was filled by the sun, it became a glass, though it had none. What am I?
An empty box I fill with sand, From morning till evening with a busy hand. I watch the box increase in size and weight, yet still it holds within, the same. What am I?
An endless ribbon, with no beginning or end, it passes through all things, but never bends.
An endless road that leads nowhere, a path shrouded in the morning's glowing light. It beckons the weary, but no journey brings rest or respite.
An endless rope, without a knot, I'm a creature that's slow to beg, my home is the dark, my food, a single egg.
An endless source of water I'm in front, behind, above, below, yet I'm not a lake nor a river. What am I?
An endless source of water, neither a river nor a lake, you can see it from every place, but you can't drink it to relieve your thirst.
An endless supply, given freely, When lost, it's hard to find, but easy to be easily.
An enormous entity, vast and wide, Yet invisible to mortal eyes, Often the source of dread, often a guise.
An hourglass that doesn't run out, sand remains unturned, still flows.
An instrument in the hand of a musician is used to control the tone. I'm not a violin, flute or a prong, what am I?
An instrument not played, that is used to produce sound. What is it?

In the desert, I lie not hidden. Men come from far to see. I have no roots and I don’t bloom, but I control the lands and its doom. What am I?
In the earth I'm hidden, in the sky I'm seen, I'm weightless as a breeze and yet have roots obscene.
In the middle of the night, I have no body, but in the day I have two. What am I?

In the midst of confusion, I bring clarity and order, A simple request, a complex solution, Solving me is an endless reward.

In the morning we are cold, in the evening we're hot. We bring people joy that they've got not.

In water held, I'm hardly ever beat.

In your hand, I crumble and fade to ash, yet when it rains, I am born anew. I bring beauty to a world that's often chaotic and rough.
In your palm, I'm soft and warm, yet when I'm set aflame, I burn and turn to ash, a fleeting moment in the hand of time, a symbol of both life and death.
Invisible, I'm always there, in the room, but out of sight. What am I? When the dark becomes light, my power fades away, vanishing from the night.
Invisible, intangible, yet constant and true, I'm with you wherever you go, ever to renew.

It is poured from a pitcher that is never full, and it fills a jug that is never empty.

It is taken from a mine; a man carries it in a woven basket; another man carries it in a cloth bag. When it is poured from the woven basket to the cloth bag, it is worth its weight in gold. What is it?
It isn't alive, but it grows; it doesn't have lungs, but it needs air; it doesn't have a mouth, but water kills it. What is it?
It makes a house shrink in winter cold, but nobody ever throws it away, its loss would leave us all quite bare.
It would take 30 minutes to walk 100 yards at 15 miles per hour.

It's in front of you but can't be seen, It's behind you but can't be heard, It can be easily carried, But when it's lost, can be quite absurd. What is it?
It's not alive, but it grows; it doesn't have a mouth, but it needs food to thrive. What is it?
It's taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case, from which it cannot be released, and yet it is used by almost every person.
It's the answer to everything, the cause of all creation. Yet it can't be seen or touched. What am I?
It's what the heart takes in every minute, more than all the gold in Fort Knox, what is it?
Large and heavy, it can only move by being pushed or pulled, it's not alive but it grows and multiplies.
Made of atoms, yet vast as the sea, hold me within you and watch me be free.
Made of many, one makes light, taken from many, one makes tight.
Making each day a brand-new spree.
My answer lies where people lay their heads to rest at night, covered and guarded.
My beginning is in mystery, my end is in tragedy, only a fool looks for me in the middle of life. What am I?
My beginning is not bold, My end is not old, I'm the last thing you see when I'm told. What am I?
My beginning is not the end, but my end is the start.
My beginnings are in the ground. I have a head and no arms or legs. I'm brought by the rain and carried by the wind. What am I?
My beginnings are small, my end is never-ending. I'm the longest living thing, yet the shortest too. What am I?
My branches reach for the heavens, my roots deep in the earth, I sing in the summer, I dance in the autumn, I rest in the winter, I bloom in the spring.
My first is in egg but not in yolk, My second is in book but not in folio. My third is in day but not at night.
My first is in iron, my second in coal, my third in steam, my fourth in smoke, all together we bring the power that makes us whole.
My first is in thread, my second in knot, my third in stitch, my fourth in cloth, the sum is the fabric of existence that clothes our world.
My heart beats heavy, yet I'm devoid of pain.
My heart echoes the world's fear.
My melody's enchanting, but I'm rarely had.
My outside is hard, my inside is soft. I'm taken from a mountain, and I'm used to write. What am I?
My presence makes the ground shake, my absence leaves it still. I'm the first, and the last and the hill.
Name three things that cannot be seen or touched.
Nobody sees it, but everyone relies on its blocks.
Not a shell, nor a carapace, yet I protect that which is mine to hold, a secret, safe and sacred.
One in the morning, one at night, brings joy and releases tensions and vice.
One is light, one is not, we're two at the start.
Protected by the spoken word, I endure.
Ripened, eaten, turned to wine, In the heart of the vine, I'm both the start and the divine.
Roams at night, unseen by man, Leaves no trace, yet steals the night's plan.
Seek a creature who roams both night and day, Takes two to tango, three to play, Lives in silence, makes no noise, And when disturbed, shows only poise.
Seek me in woods, see me in fields, touch me to feel the earth yield. What am I?
Seven days I'm spread, each day a chapter, eight hours long, my power immense. I bring rest and rejuvenate, to the lives of many a creature.
Sharp things that prick and pierce, guardians of the fruit, my power increases, in defense, I cease to be discrete.
Silent and still, I flow through the night, with a gentle hum against the ear, from the land, to the sea, to the very stars that pierce the sky, I draw you ever near.
Silent letters I carry, 10 times add me, What's the number that I form?
Silent serpent, hidden in the grass, I can't be touched, yet I'm a gas.
Six faces and thirteen heads, A riddle unsolved, The more you talk, The harder it spreads.

Sometimes I'm thick and sometimes thin, you can spread me over bread, but if you take me inside, you'll get in trouble instead.
Speak and I'll live, be quiet and I'll die.

Take away the first letter, add two letters, and change but one, and you have my name. What is it?
Take out a letter and a sound remains. Silent and still, I am a power.
Tapped, it runs freely; pressed, it stands tall. What is it that changes in the wind, answering some, if not all?
Tear me down, build me up, I'm not alive but I grow, What am I that in time always bows?
Tells you its riddles before it draws its final thread.
That's sometimes heavy but can never be found.
The answer I propose is yes, but the real question is no. What question sought to test my truth?
The clock ticks on, never sleeping, but what I make ticks not at all.
The color of the sun, the color of the moon, the color of the wind, what am I?

When you're missing someone, me or him or she.
Where nothing is, is the beginning, where everything ends, is the end. Where you find yourself, is both, without end or beginning.
Which creature wears its teeth on its stomach?
Which has more letters than a post-office box?
Which is the heaviest letter?
Which letter is so mean, it's the only one that doesn't get a New Year's greeting?
Which letter, when capitalized, represents the entire alphabet?
Which letter, when it comes as the third in a word, goes up the hill but comes down at the end?
Which one turns back time, taking us apart?

Which word is so commonly misspelled, it is rarely spelled correctly?
Which word is spoken, seldom written And faintly heard only under the moon's shining?
Whispers echo in my core, yet I'm weightless and pure. Invisible but present, in love and in lure.
Who am I that shines in the night? I twinkle and gleam, I'm a poem in the sky, I inspire dreams, I'm a thing of delight.
Who can travel all around the world without leaving their home town?
Who comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
Who has keys but can't open locks?
Who is hanged in the middle of a town?
Who laughs in the wind, or whispers through trees, who touches the face, of the azure seas?
Who walks on four paws in the morning, two legs at noon, and three legs in the evening?
With a back that bends and a head that nods, I carry stories and songs, countless tales that remain unspoken aloud.
With a face you cannot see, a voice you cannot hear, a back that cannot bend, and tears that cannot flow, yet I am often in the deepest heart of human beings. What am I?
With a hat and a coat, I'll keep you warm. Put me on a bed, I might give you a alarm.
With a head not for seeing, a heart not for feeling, I'm a silent, unfeeling king.
With a name that's long, I can be bold, I make the earth's core hot and old.
With a neck but no head, arms but no hands, I have a heart that does not beat.
With a ring I catch the wind, not a fish, nor a bird, but something precious that's hardly worth. What am I?
With a serpent as company, I often bemoan.
With a tap on the shoulder, it starts to bed.
With a touch, I bring life, with a breath, I snuff it out. I am as endless as the cosmos' might, a creator, destroyer, life's eternal knight. What am I?
With a touch, I ignite, a sensation hot and bright. In darkness I hide, yet I cannot take flight.
With hands that never feel, and eyes that never see, I live a solitary life, a life without decree. I've held the world in my grasp, and watched as time has passed.
With me you can't go far, either by land or by sea, yet I make the most wonderful noises, and am an essential part of your life. What am I?
With me, you can hide and seek. I'm found in forests, deserts, and shores. I have no leaves, no roots, but I bring colors to the world.
With me, you lose track of time. But moments spent with me, you'll never want to unwind.
With me, you're always empty, without me, you're never full: What am I?
With mouths I have not, eyes I have not, yet I can eat and I can spit. What am I?
With seven heads and seven times seven legs, A creature of mystery, I crawl from egg to egg.
Within the vast, unfathomable void, I am the silent, watchful guide. I lead the stars through eons of time, their celestial dance, an unending rhyme. What am I?
Without me, words have no meaning. Without me, ideas are incomplete. Without me, life has no sound.
Without me, words have no power. Take me away, and I'll leave black marks behind. What am I?
Without me, you won't go far, without me, you won't go near. What am I?
Without me, you wouldn't see, A world of color on display, What am I that paints the scene?

X: I'm light as a feather, yet the strongest man cannot hold me for much longer than a minute. What am I?

Yet the strongest person can't hold it for longer than a minute.
Yet, the biggest one can fit in your hand with great mirth.
You cannot see, touch, or smell me, yet you use me every day. What am I?
You find me in a day, you lose me in a week, I am saved by a king. What am I?
You find me in despair, you find me in laughter, Some call me a dreamer, others a slayer. What shapes the world, as seen by its after?
You find me in the middle of a pack, where I belong, if taken from it, back I long. What am I?
You find me in the ocean, in every drop, when you add one part to ten, I remain. What am I?
You see a house fly every day, but you cannot make it fly. What is it?
You see a house, but I live in it. You plant my seeds in a garden, but I'm never grown. What am I?
You see a lady in the bathtub, dead but beautiful. She opens her eyes to look around the room and says, "Pity." What is her dress made of?
You see a man as he is. You meet him in times of trouble or joy. What can you learn from him?
You see a piece of me in mirrors, in water, and on a foggy night. What am I?
You see a piece of me in the mirror every day, but what you don't see is the most essential part.
You see a thousand in your lifetime, yet none in a day. I'm not a bird, what am I?
You throw it away, but you keep what it's in.
You throw it out, but you call it back when it lands on the ground. What is it?
You'll find me under your bed, In your wardrobe, and in your attic, I'll stay with you forever, until you forget it. What am I?
what am I, with no shape or form, that all can see yet none can define?
